resourceType.description: Identifies the type of resource, such as: a dataset, study, publication, etc.

abstract.description: Brief narrative summary of the content of the resource.

shortAbstract.description: A short description of the resource. Max of 300 characters.

purpose.description: A summary of intentions for which the resource was created.

timePeriod.description: Time period for the resource, e.g. project start and end date(s).

credit.description: A narrative identification of additional resources credited for the resource.

topicCategory.description:
**This property is deprecated in favor of using a keyword entry with a type of "isoTopicCategory".**

General theme keyword of the resource, such as: oceans, biota atmosphere, etc.

pointOfContact.description: Identification of, and means of communication with, person(s) and organizations that may be contacted for acquiring knowledge about or acquisition of the resource.

spatialReferenceSystem.description: Geospatial referencing system used in the the data resource. The reference can be provided by an EPSG number, a named reference, or providing the parameters in a well known text (WKT) format.

ISO 19115-2: MD_Metadata > referenceSystemInfo > MD_ReferenceSystem > referenceSystemIdentifier > RS_Identifier > code

spatialRepresentationType.description: Format of the resource geographic extent, such as: vector, grid, etc.

spatialRepresentation.description: Method used to spatially represent geographic information.

spatialResolution.description: Information about the scale of the geographic extent.

temporalResolution.description: Information about the termporal period of the resource.

extent.description: Information about the geographic, vertical, and temporal extent of the resource. A resource may have multiple extents.

coverageDescription.description: Details about the content of a raster(grid) resource.

taxonomy.description: Information on the taxa (1 or more) included in the data set, including keywords, taxonomic system and coverage information, and taxonomic classification system.

graphicOverview.description: Provides a path or link to images, maps, flow charts, models, etc. that illustrate the resource.

resourceFormat.description: Provides a description of the format of the resource.

keyword.description: Provides category keywords, their type, and reference source.

resourceUsage.description: Description of ways in which the resource is currently or has been used.

constraint.description: Provides information about constraints to the use of the resource.

defaultResourceLocale.description: Localised language(s) and characterset(s) used within the resource.

otherResourceLocale.description: Alternate localised language(s) and characterset(s) used within the resource.

resourceMaintenance.description: Information about the maintenance of the resource.

environmentDescription.description: Description of the dataset in the producer's processing environment, including items such as the software, the computer, the computer operating system, file name, and the dataset size.

supplementalInfo.description: Any other descriptive information about the dataset.

resourceType.json.title: resourceType
resourceType.json.description: Identifies the kinds and scope of items in the resource

type.description: The type of resource(or component of a resource) being described.

name.description: The name of the resource component.

title.description: Name by which the cited resource is known.

alternateTitle.description: Alias by which the cited resource is known.

date.description: Date referenced to the cited resource.

responsibleParty.description: Identification of, and means of communication with, person(s) and organization(s) associated with the cited resource.

presentationForm.description: The form that the resource is presented, such as: digital map, digital document, etc.

identifier.description: Identifier for the resource in the context of the citation.

otherCitationDetails.description: Other information required to complete the citation that is not recorded elsewhere.

onlineResource.description: On-line information related to the citation.

ISO 19115-2: CI_Citation > citedResponsibleParty > CI_ResponsibleParty > contact > CI_Contact > onlineResource > CI_OnlineResource

graphic.description: Online graphic associated with the citation

series.title: series
series.description: Information about the series, or aggregate resource, to which a resource belongs.

description.description: Supplemental information describing the date context.

role.description: Function performed by the contact in the current context.

roleExtent.description: The area or period of time for which the role is valid.

party.description: Identifies all the contacts associated with the role.

contactId.description: Identifier matching a contactId in the main contact array.

organizationMembers.description: Identifies individuals that have an association with an organization contact.

extent.json.description: Information about the geographic, vertical, and temporal extent of a resource.

verticalExtent.description: An array of objects each describing a vertical boundary comprising all or a portion of the resource.

temporalExtent.description: An array of objects each describing a temporal boundary comprising all or a portion of the resource.

geographicExtent.json.description: Describes the spatial area of the resource

containsData.description: Idication of whether the geographic element encompasses an area covered by the data or an area where data are not present.

boundingBox.description: General geographic position of the resource.

geographicElement.description: An array of objects each describing a geographic boundary or location comprising all or a portion of the resource.

description.description: Short description of the geographic areal domain of the data set. Examples include, "Manistee River watershed", "extent of 7 ½ minute quads containing any property belonging to Yellowstone National Park", or "ponds and reservoirs larger than 2 acres in Jefferson County, Colorado".

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_GeographicDescription > geographicIdentifier > MD_Identifier > code

boundingBox.description: The four sides of geodetic box defining the area of the resource

westLongitude.description: Western-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in longitude, in decimal degrees.

eastLongitude.description: Eastern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in longitude, in decimal degrees.

southLatitude.description: Southern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in latitude, in decimal degrees.

northLatitude.description: Northern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in latitude, in decimal degrees.

minimumAltitude.description: The minimum altitude(height above sea level) extent of coverage.

maximumAltitude.description: The maximum altitude(height above sea level) extent of coverage.

unitsOfAltitude.description: The units of measure in which altitude is expressed.

identifier.description: A name that is used to identify the resource.

namespace.description: A string which unambiguously defines the namespace for the identifier.

description.description: A natural language description of the meaning of the identifier value.

authority.description: Citation for the authority issuing the identifier.

geographicExtent.json_definitions_boundi.description: The four sides of geodetic box defining the area of the resource

westLongitude.description: Western-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in longitude, in decimal degrees.

eastLongitude.description: Eastern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in longitude, in decimal degrees.

southLatitude.description: Southern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in latitude, in decimal degrees.

northLatitude.description: Northern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in latitude, in decimal degrees.

minimumAltitude.description: The minimum altitude(height above sea level) extent of coverage.

maximumAltitude.description: The maximum altitude(height above sea level) extent of coverage.

unitsOfAltitude.description: The units of measure in which altitude is expressed.

geojson.json.title: GeoJSON object
geojson.json.description:
GeoJSON is a format for encoding a variety of geographic data structures. A GeoJSON object may represent a geometry, a feature, or a collection of features. 

GeoJSON supports the following geometry types: Point, LineString, Polygon, MultiPoint, MultiLineString, MultiPolygon, and GeometryCollection. Features in GeoJSON contain a geometry object and additional properties, and a feature collection represents a list of features. 

 The coordinate reference system for all GeoJSON coordinates is a geographic coordinate reference system, using the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS 84) [WGS84] datum, with longitude and latitude units    of decimal degrees.  This is equivalent to the coordinate reference    system identified by the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) URN    urn:ogc:def:crs:OGC::CRS84. 

See http://geojson.org for the full specification.

geometries.description: The set of geometry objects constituting the GeometryCollection.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > MultiGeometry > geometryMembers

feature.title: Feature
feature.description: A GeoJSON object with the type "Feature" is a feature object. A feature object has a geometry, properties, and an optional identifier.

geometry.description: The geometry object associated with the Feature.

oneOf.title: null geometry
oneOf.description: A feature object with no associated geometry. For example, a null value may be used when defining a bounding box only.

id.description: Unique identifier for the GeoJSON feature object.

featureCollection.title: FeatureCollection
featureCollection.description: A GeoJSON object comprised of multiple Feature objects.

features.description: Set of Features constituting the FeatureCollection.

featureProperties.title: FeatureProperties
featureProperties.description: JSON object containing information about a feature or collection.

oneOf.title: null
oneOf.description: A feature object with no identified properties.

ISO 19115-2: geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > [Point, LineString, Polygon] > description

featureName.description: A title associated with a feature.

ISO 19115-2: geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > [Point, LineString, Polygon] > name

featureScope.description: A word or phrase identifying the type of object described by the feature.

acquisitionMethod.description: Method used to establish the position of the geographic feature.

identifier.description: Identifier for the geographic element with optional cited authority.

bbox.json.description: A GeoJSON object MAY have a member named 'bbox' to include information on the coordinate range for its Geometries, Features, or FeatureCollections. The value of the bbox member MUST be an array of length 2 * n where n is the number of dimensions represented in the contained geometries, with all axes of the most southwesterly point followed by all axes of the more northeasterly point. The axes order of a bbox follows the axes order of geometries. The values of a 'bbox' array are[west, south, east, north].

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_GeographicBoundingBox, EX_GeographicBoundingBox > westBoundLongitude > Decimal {west}, EX_GeographicBoundingBox > eastBoundLongitude > Decimal {east}, EX_GeographicBoundingBox > southBoundLatitude > Decimal {south}, EX_GeographicBoundingBox > northBoundLatitude > Decimal {north}
FGDC CSDGM: [idinfo > spdom > bounding > westbc], [idinfo > spdom > bounding > eastbc], [idinfo > spdom > bounding > northbc], [idinfo > spdom > bounding > southbc]

geometry.json.title: geometry
geometry.json.description:
A geometry is a GeoJSON object where the type member's value is one of the following strings: "Point", "MultiPoint", "LineString", "MultiLineString", "Polygon", "MultiPolygon", or "GeometryCollection".

A GeoJSON geometry object of any type other than "GeometryCollection" must have a member with the name "coordinates". The value of the coordinates member is always an array. The structure for the elements in this array is determined by the type of geometry.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > [Point | LineString | Polygon > [interior | exterior] | MultiGeometry]

coordinates.description: The position representing a point, represented by an array of numbers following x, y, z order (easting, northing, altitude for coordinates in a projected coordinate reference system, or longitude, latitude, altitude for coordinates in a geographic coordinate reference system).

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > Point > coordinates

oneOf.title: MultiPoint
oneOf.description: A geographic object comprised of multiple points.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > MultiGeometry > geometryMembers > Point[ ]

coordinates.description: The set of positions that constitute the MultiPoint geometry.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > MultiGeometry > geometryMembers > Point[ ] > coordinates

oneOf.title: LineString
oneOf.description: A geometry object comprised of a minimum of two positions.

coordinates.description: The set of positions that constitute the LineString geometry.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > LineString > coordinates

oneOf.title: MultiLineString
oneOf.description: A geometry object comprised of one or more LineStrings.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > MultiGeometry > geometryMembers > LineString[ ]

coordinates.description: The set of LineString(s) that constitute the MultiLineString.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > MultiGeometry > geometryMembers > LineString[ ] > coordinates

oneOf.title: Polygon
oneOf.description:
A geometry object that is composed of a set of LinearRings. A LinearRing is a closed LineString with 4 or more positions. The first and last positions are equivalent (they represent equivalent points).

For Polygons with multiple rings, the first must be the exterior ring and any others must be interior rings or holes.

oneOf.title: MultiPolygon
oneOf.description: A geometry object comprised of multiple polygons.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > MultiGeometry > geometryMembers > Polygon[ ]

coordinates.description: The set of Polygons that constitute the MultiPolygon.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > MultiGeometry > geometryMembers > Polygon[ ] > [exterior > LinearRing > coordinates | interior[ ] > LinearRing > coordinates]

position.title: position
position.description: A position is the fundamental geometry construct. A position is represented by an array of numbers following x, y, z order (easting, northing, altitude for coordinates in a projected coordinate reference system, or longitude, latitude, altitude for coordinates in a geographic coordinate reference system).

lineString.title: lineString
lineString.description: An array of two or more positions

allOf.title: minimum 2
allOf.description: The LineString must consist of two or more positions

linearRing.title: LinearRing
linearRing.description: An array of a minimum of four positions where the first equals the last

allOf.title: minimum 4
allOf.description: A LinearRing is a closed LineString with 4 or more positions.

polygon.title: Polygon
polygon.description: A set of LinearRings that constitute a Polygon geometry. For Polygons with multiple rings, the first must be the exterior ring and any others must be interior rings or holes.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > Polygon > [exterior > LinearRing > coordinates | interior[ ] > LinearRing > coordinates]

geometry.json_definitions_position.description: A position is the fundamental geometry construct. geometry.json_definitions_polygon.description: A set of LinearRings that constitute a Polygon geometry. For Polygons with multiple rings, the first must be the exterior ring and any others must be interior rings or holes.

ISO 19115-2: EX_Extent > geographicElement > EX_BoundingPolygon > polygon > Polygon > [exterior > LinearRing > coordinates | interior[ ] > LinearRing > coordinates]

allOf.title: minimum 4

description.description: A brief description providing relevant information about the verticalExtent.

minValue.description: Lowest vertical extent contained in the resource.

maxValue.description: Highest vertical extent contained in the resource.

crsId.description: Identifies the vertical coordinate reference system used for the minimum and maximum values.

referenceSystemIdentifier.description: The reference system identifier or definition.

referenceSystemWKT.description: Well Known Text (WKT) for spatial reference system.

referenceSystemParameterSet.json.title: referenceSystemParameterSet
referenceSystemParameterSet.json.description: The set of parameters describing a spatial reference system.

projection.json.title: projection
projection.json.description: The set of parameters for the projection that applies to the resource.

identifier.description: The identifier for the projection. Combine with a namespace to explicitly identify the projection. For example, code="albers" and namespace="org.adiwg.code.mapProjection".

description.description: A complete description of a grid system, not defined elsewhere in this standard, that was used for the data set. The information provided shall include the name of the grid system, the names of the parameters and values used for the data set, and the citation of the specification for the algorithms that describe the mathematical relationship between the Earth and the coordinates of the grid system.

name.description: A descriptive name for the projection.

gridIdentifier.description: The identifier for the grid system.

identifier.description: The identifier for the grid system. Combine with a namespace to explicitly identify the grid system. For example, code="utm" and namespace="org.adiwg.code.mapGridSystem".

description.description: A complete description of a grid system, not defined elsewhere in this standard, that was used for the data set. The information provided shall include the name of the grid system, the names of the parameters and values used for the data set, and the citation of the specification for the algorithms that describe the mathematical relationship between the Earth and the coordinates of the grid system.

name.description: A descriptive name for the grid system.

gridZone.description: The unique zone identifier for grid coordinate systems.

standardParallel1.description: The line of constant latitude at which the surface of the Earth and the plane or developable surface intersect.

standardParallel2.description: The line of constant latitude at which the surface of the Earth and the plane or developable surface intersect.

longitudeOfCentralMeridian.description: The line of longitude at the center of a map projection generally used as the basis for constructing the projection.

latitudeOfProjectionOrigin.description: The latitude chosen as the origin of rectangular coordinates for a map projection.

falseEasting.description: The value added to all 'x' values in the rectangular coordinates for a map projection. This value frequently is assigned to eliminate negative numbers.

falseNorthing.description: The value added to all 'y' values in the rectangular coordinates for a map projection. This value frequently is assigned to eliminate negative numbers.

falseEastingNorthingUnits.description: The units of measure for falseEasting and falseNorthing.

scaleFactorAtEquator.description: A multiplier for reducing a distance obtained from a map by computation or scaling to the actual distance along the equator.

heightOfProspectivePointAboveSurface.description: The height of viewpoint above the Earth, expressed in meters.

longitudeOfProjectionCenter.description: The longitude of the point of projection for azimuthal projections.

latitudeOfProjectionCenter.description: The latitude of the point of projection for azimuthal projections.

scaleFactorAtCenterLine.description: A multiplier for reducing a distance obtained from a map by computation or scaling to the actual distance along the center line.

scaleFactorAtCentralMeridian.description: A multiplier for reducing a distance obtained from a map by computation or scaling to the actual distance along the central meridian.

straightVerticalLongitudeFromPole.description: The longitude to be oriented straight up from the North or South Pole.

scaleFactorAtProjectionOrigin.description: A multiplier for reducing a distance obtained from a map by computation or scaling to the actual distance at the projection origin.

azimuthAngle.description: The angle measured clockwise from north, and expressed in degrees.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > mapprojp > obqlazim > azimangl

azimuthMeasurePointLongitude.description: The longitude of the map projection origin.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > mapprojp > obqlazim > azimptl

landsatNumber.description: The number of the Landsat satellite.

landsatPath.description: The number of the orbit of the Landsat satellite.

obliqueLinePoint.description: The method used to describe the line along which an oblique Mercator map projection is centered using two points near the limits of the mapped region that define the center line.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > mapproj > obqmerc > obqlpt

items.title: point
items.description: A point near the limits of the mapped region that define the center line for an oblique Mercator map projection.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > mapproj > obqmerc > obqlpt

obliqueLineLatitude.description: The latitude of a point defining the oblique line.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > mapproj > obqmerc > obqlpt > obqllat

obliqueLineLongitude.description: The longitude of a point defining the oblique line.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > mapproj > obqmerc > obqlpt > obqllong

local.description: A description of a local coordinate system.

description.description: A description of the local reference system.

georeference.description: A description of the information provided to register the local system to the Earth (e.g. control points, satellite ephemeral data, inertial navigation data).

fixedToEarth.description: True if the z-axis of the coordinate system coincides with a plumb line through the origin that locally is aligned with the surface of the Earth.

obliqueLineLongitude.description: The longitude of a point defining the oblique line.

projection.json_definitions_local.description: A description of a local coordinate system.

description.description: A description of the local reference system.

georeference.description: A description of the information provided to register the local system to the Earth (e.g. control points, satellite ephemeral data, inertial navigation data).

fixedToEarth.description: True if the z-axis of the coordinate system coincides with a plumb line through the origin that locally is aligned with the surface of the Earth.

geodetic.json.title: geodetic
geodetic.json.description: Parameters for defining the shape of the earth.

datumIdentifier.description: The identification given to the reference system used for defining the coordinates of points.

ellipsoidIdentifier.description: The identification given to established representations of the Earth's shape.

semiMajorAxis.description: The radius of the equatorial axis of the ellipsoid.

ISO 19115-2: referenceSystemInfo > MD_CRS > projection > ellipsoidParameters > MD_EllipsoidParameters > semiMajorAxis

axisUnits.description: The units of the semi-major axis.

ISO 19115-2: referenceSystemInfo > MD_CRS > projection > ellipsoidParameters > MD_EllipsoidParameters > axisUnits

denominatorOfFlatteningRatio.description: The denominator of the ratio of the difference between the equatorial and polar radii of the ellipsoid when the numerator is set to 1.

ISO 19115-2: referenceSystemInfo > MD_CRS > projection > ellipsoidParameters > MD_EllipsoidParameters > denominatorOfFlatteningRatio

verticalDatum.json.title: verticalDatum
verticalDatum.json.description: The reference frame or system from which vertical distances (altitudes or depths) are measured.

datumIdentifier.description: The identification given to the surface taken as the surface of reference from which altitudes or depths are measured.

encodingMethod.description: The means used to encode the altitudes.

isDepthSystem.description: True if depth system, false if altitude system.

verticalResolution.description: The minimum distance possible between two adjacent altitude or depth values, expressed in units of measure.

unitOfMeasure.description: The units of measure for altitude or depth measurements.

temporalExtent.json.description: A temporal boundary comprising all or a portion of the resource.

timeInstant.description: Represents an identifiable position in time.

id.description: A unique identifier for the timeInstant.

description.description: A brief description providing relevant information about the date and time.

geologicAge.json.title: geologicAge
geologicAge.json.description: A name, code, or date describing an event or period in geologic time, expressed either as an absolute date calculated using a named dating method, or as a relative date that is drawn from stratigraphy or biostratigraphy.

ageTimeScale.description: Name of a recognized geologic time scale. This includes "Absolute" as the name of the time scale for measuring geologic dates before the present and names of geologic dating systems that are arrangements of symbols or names in order of relative geologic time

ageEstimate.description: Either an absolute geologic date or a relative geologic age name describing an event or period in geologic time based on the Geologic_Time_Scale.

ageUncertainty.description: The error estimate for the geologic time. This should include the units of measure, a description of what the error estimate represents and how it was calculated.

ageExplanation.description: The name and/or description of the method used to calculate the ageEstimate. Detailed information about the method may be provided through references contained in the ageReference.

ageReference.description: Citation for works providing detailed information about any element of the geologicAge.

timePeriod.json.description: A span of time represented by a starting date-time and an ending date-time.

id.description: A unique identifier for a time period.

description.description: A brief description providing relevant information about the time period.

periodName.description: Names associated with the time period.

oneOf.title: dateTime
oneOf.description: A timePeriod with a startDateTime and/or endDateTime.

startDateTime.description: Starting date, or date and time.

endDateTime.description: Ending date, or date and time.

oneOf.title: geologicAge
oneOf.description: A timePeriod with a startGeologicAge and/or endGeologicAge.

startGeologicAge.description: A name, code, or date for the beginning of an event or period in geologic time.

endGeologicAge.description: A name, code, or date for the end of an event or period in geologic time.

duration.description: Object for collecting information about a duration or period of time.

timeInterval.description: Defines a length of time in specific units.

units.description: The unit of time for the interval.

timePeriod.json_definitions_timeInterval.description: Defines a length of time in specific units.

units.description: The unit of time for the interval.

timePeriod.json_definitions_duration.description: Object for collecting information about a duration or period of time.

contactId.description: Identifier matching a contactId in the main contact array.

organizationMembers.description: Identifies individuals that have an association with an organization contact.

citation.json_definitions_series.title: series
citation.json_definitions_series.description: Information about the series, or aggregate resource, to which a resource belongs.

onlineResource.json.description: Information about accessing online resources and services.

protocol.description: The connection protocol to be used such as: ftp, http, etc.

description.description: Detailed text description of what the online resource is/does.

function.description: Function performed by the online resource.

applicationProfile.description: Name of an application profile that can be used with the online resource.

protocolRequest.description: Request used to access the resource depending on the protocol, e.g. body of POST(http)_ request.

common.json_definitions_uri.description: Location (address) for on-line access using a Uniform Resource Identifier, usually in the form of a Uniform Resource Locator (URL).

graphic.json.title: graphic
graphic.json.description: Provides a path or link to images, maps, flow charts, models, etc. that illustrate the resource.

fileName.description: Name of the file that contains a graphic describing the resource.

fileType.description: The format in which the illustration is encoded such as GIF, JPEG, PBM, PS, TIFF.

fileConstraint.description: Identifies, legal, security, and other constraint requirements associated with use and distribution of the graphic

anyOf.title: security required if type is security
legal required if type is legal

useLimitation.description: Limitation affecting the fitness for use of the resource or metadata. For example, "not to be used for navigation".

scope.description: temporal extent and or level of the application of the constraint restrictions.

graphic.description: Graphic or symbol indicating the constraint

reference.description: Citation for the limitation or constraint

releasability.description: Information concerning the parties to who the resource can or cannot be released.

responsibleParty.description: Entity responsible for the resource constraint

legalConstraint.description: Restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing and using the resource or metadata.

accessConstraint.description: Access constraints applied to assure the protection of privacy or intellectual property, and any special restrictions or limitations on obtaining the resource or metadata.

useConstraint.description: Constraints applied to assure the protection of privacy or intellectual property, and any special restrictions or limitations or warnings on using the resource or metadata.

otherConstraint.description: Other restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing and using the resource or metadata.

securityConstraint.description: Handling restrictions imposed on the resource or metadata for national security or similar security concerns.

classification.description: Name of the handling restrictions on the resource or metadata.

userNote.description: Explanation of the application of the legal constraints or other restrictions and legal prerequisites for obtaining and using the resource or metadata.

classificationSystem.description: Name of the classification system associated with a security constraint.

handlingDescription.description: Additional description regarding the security handling of the resource or metadata.

scope.json.description: The target resource and physical extent for which information is reported.

scopeCode.description: Class of information to which the resource applies.

scopeDescription.description: Detailed description/listing of the items specified by the scope.

scopeExtent.description: Information about the horizontal, vertical and temporal extent of the resource specified by the scope.

dataset.description: Dataset to which the information applies.

attributes.description: Instances of attribute types to which the information is applied.

features.description: Instances of feature types to which the information is applied.

other.description: Class of information that does not fall into the other categories to which the information applies.

dataset.description: Dataset to which the information applies.

attributes.description: Instances of attribute types to which the information is applied.

features.description: Instances of feature types to which the information is applied.

other.description: Class of information that does not fall into the other categories to which the information applies.

constraint.json_definitions_legalConstra.description: Restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing and using the resource or metadata.

accessConstraint.description: Access constraints applied to assure the protection of privacy or intellectual property, and any special restrictions or limitations on obtaining the resource or metadata.

useConstraint.description: Constraints applied to assure the protection of privacy or intellectual property, and any special restrictions or limitations or warnings on using the resource or metadata.

otherConstraint.description: Other restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing and using the resource or metadata.

constraint.json_definitions_securityCons.description: Handling restrictions imposed on the resource or metadata for national security or similar security concerns.

classification.description: Name of the handling restrictions on the resource or metadata.

userNote.description: Explanation of the application of the legal constraints or other restrictions and legal prerequisites for obtaining and using the resource or metadata.

classificationSystem.description: Name of the classification system associated with a security constraint.

handlingDescription.description: Additional description regarding the security handling of the resource or metadata.

gridRepresentation.json.description: Information about grid objects in the resource.

numberOfDimensions.description: The number of independent spatial-temporal axes.

cellGeometry.description: Identification of grid data as point or cell.

transformationParameterAvailable.description: An indication of whether or not parameters for transformation between image coordinates and geographic or map coordinates exist (are available).

dimensionType.description: The type of dimension for this axis.

dimensionSize.description: The number of elements along the axis.

resolution.description: The degree of detail in the grid.

dimensionType.description: The type of dimension for this axis.

dimensionSize.description: The number of elements along the axis.

resolution.description: The degree of detail in the grid.

value.description: The number of units in the measurement.

unitOfMeasure.description: The type of units to associated with the value.

vectorRepresentation.json.description: Information about the vector spatial objects in the resource

topologyLevel.description: Identifies the degree of complexity of the spatial relationships

vectorObject.description: Information about the geometric objects used in the resource
Information about the geometric objects used in the resource.

objectType.description: Name of point or vector objects used to locate zero-, one-, two-, or three-dimensional spatial locations in the resource.

objectCount.description: The total number of point or vector objects occurring in the dataset.

vectorRepresentation.json_definitions_ve.description: Information about the geometric objects used in the resource.

objectType.description: Name of point or vector objects used to locate zero-, one-, two-, or three-dimensional spatial locations in the resource.

objectCount.description: The total number of point or vector objects occurring in the dataset.

georectifiedRepresentation.json.description: A grid whose cells are regularly spaced in a geographic (i.e. lat/long) or map coordinate system defined in the SpatialReferencing System (SRS) so that any cell in the grid can be geolocated given its grid coordinates and the grid origin, cell spacing, and orientation.

checkPointAvailable.description: Idication of whether or not geographic position points are available to test the accuracy of the georeferenced grid data.

checkPointDescription.description: Description of geographic positions points used to test the accuracy of the georeferenced grid data.

cornerPoints.description: The earth location in the coordinate system defined by the Spatial Reference System and the grid coordinate of the cells at opposite ends of grid coverage along two diagonals in the grid spatial dimensions. Note: There are four corner points in a georectified grid; at least two corner points along one diagonal are required. The first corner point corresponds to the origin of the grid.

centerPoint.description: The earth location in the coordinate system defined by the Spatial Reference System and the grid coordinate of the cell halfway between opposite ends of the grid in the spatial dimensions.

pointInPixel.description: Point in a pixel corresponding to the Earth location of the pixel.

transformationDimensionDescription.description: Point in a pixel corresponding to the Earth location of the pixel.

transformationDimensionMapping.description: Point in a pixel corresponding to the Earth location of the pixel.

georeferenceableRepresentation.json.title: georeferenceableRepresentation
georeferenceableRepresentation.json.description: Grid with cells irregularly spaced in any given geographic/map projection coordinate system, whose individual cells can be geolocated using geolocation information supplied with the data but cannot be geolocated from the grid properties alone.

controlPointAvailable.description: Indication of whether or not control point(s) exist.

orientationParameterAvailable.description: Description of the parameters used to describe sensor orientation.

orientationParameterDescription.description: Description of parameters used to describe sensor orientation.

georeferencedParameter.description: Information which support grid data georeferencing.

parameterCitation.description: Reference providing description of the parameters.

spatialResolution.json.description: Information about the scale of the geographic extent.

scaleFactor.title: scaleFactor
scaleFactor.description: Scale of geographic extent expressed in a hardcopy map scale fraction (denominator).

measure.title: measure
measure.description: Scale of geographic extent expressed in ground distance parameters or angle.

levelOfDetail.title: levelOfDetail
levelOfDetail.description: A brief textual description of the spatial resolution of the resource

geographicResolution.description: The quantities of latitude and longitude which define the position of a point on the Earth's surface with respect to a reference spheroid.

latitudeResolution.description: The minimum difference between two adjacent latitude values expressed in Geographic Coordinate Units of measure.

longitudeResolution.description: The minimum difference between two adjacent longitude values expressed in Geographic Coordinate Units of measure.

unitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure used for the latitude and longitude values.

bearingDistanceResolution.description: The method of encoding the position of a point by measuring its distance and direction (azimuth angle) from another point.

distanceResolution.description: The minimum distance measurable between two points, expressed Planar Distance Units of measure.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > planci > distbrep > distres

distanceUnitOfMeasure.description: The units for the distance resolution.

bearingResolution.description: The minimum angle measurable between two points, expressed in Bearing Units of measure.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > planci > distbrep > bearres

bearingUnitOfMeasure.description: The units of measure used for angles.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > planci > distbrep > bearunit

bearingReferenceDirection.description: The direction from which the bearing is measured.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > planci > distbrep > bearrefd

bearingReferenceMeridian.description: The axis from which the bearing is measured.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > planci > distbrep > bearrefm

abscissaResolutionX.description: The (nominal) minimum distance between the 'x' or column values of two adjacent points, expressed in Planar Distance.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > planci > coordrep > absres

ordinateResolutionY.description: The (nominal) minimum distance between the 'y' or column values of two adjacent points, expressed in Planar Distance.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > planci > coordrep > ordres

unitOfMeasure.description: The units of the ordinate and abscissa axis.

latitudeResolution.description: The minimum difference between two adjacent latitude values expressed in Geographic Coordinate Units of measure.

longitudeResolution.description: The minimum difference between two adjacent longitude values expressed in Geographic Coordinate Units of measure.

unitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure used for the latitude and longitude values.

spatialResolution.json_definitions_beari.description: The method of encoding the position of a point by measuring its distance and direction (azimuth angle) from another point.

distanceResolution.description: The minimum distance measurable between two points, expressed Planar Distance Units of measure.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > planci > distbrep > distres

distanceUnitOfMeasure.description: The units for the distance resolution.

bearingResolution.description: The minimum angle measurable between two points, expressed in Bearing Units of measure.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > planci > distbrep > bearres

bearingUnitOfMeasure.description: The units of measure used for angles.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > planci > distbrep > bearunit

bearingReferenceDirection.description: The direction from which the bearing is measured.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > planci > distbrep > bearrefd

bearingReferenceMeridian.description: The axis from which the bearing is measured.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > planci > distbrep > bearrefm

abscissaResolutionX.description: The (nominal) minimum distance between the 'x' or column values of two adjacent points, expressed in Planar Distance.

ordinateResolutionY.description: The (nominal) minimum distance between the 'y' or column values of two adjacent points, expressed in Planar Distance.

unitOfMeasure.description: The units of the ordinate and abscissa axis.

coverageDescription.json.description: Details about the content of a raster resource.

processingLevelCode.description: Code that identifies the level of radiometric and geometric processing that has been applied.

attributeGroup.description: Information about groups of attributes describing a coverage.

attributeGroup.json.description: Information about groups of attributes describing a coverage.

attributeContentType.description: Type of information represented by the values

sequenceIdentifier.description: Unique name or number that identifies attributes included in the coverage.

ISO 19115-2: MI_CoverageDescription >  gmd:dimension > gmd:MD:Band > gmd:sequenceIdentifier > gco:MemberName > gco:aName

sequenceIdentifierType.description: The type of unique name or number that identifies attributes.

ISO 19115-2: MI_CoverageDescription > gmd:dimension > gmd:MD:Band > gmd:sequenceIdentifier > gco:MemberName > gco:attributeType > gco:TypeName > gco:aName

attributeIdentifier.description: Identifiers for each attribute included in the resource. NOTE: These identifiers can be used to provide names for the attribute from a standard set of names.

minValue.description: The minimum value of data values in the domain of the attribute.

maxValue.description: The maximum value of data values in the domain of the attribute

units.description: The units of data in which the attribute is expressed.

ISO 19115-2: MI_CoverageDescription > gmd:dimension > gmd:MD_Band > gmd:units > gml:unitDefinition > gml:identifier

scaleFactor.description: The scale factor which has been applied to the attribute.

offset.description: The physical value corresponding to an attribute value of zero.

meanValue.description: The mean value of data values in the attribute.

numberOfValues.description: Tthe number of values used in a thematic-Classification resource.

standardDeviation.description: The standard deviation of data values in the attribute.

bitsPerValue.description: The maximum number of significant bits in the uncompressed representation for the value in each pixel.

boundMin.description: The shortest wavelength that the sensor is capable of collecting within a designated band.

boundMax.description: The longest wavelength that the sensor is capable of collecting within a designated band.

boundUnits.description: The unit in which sensor wavelengths are expressed.

peakResponse.description: The wavelength at which the sensor response is highest.

toneGradations.description: The number of discrete numerical values in the grid data.

bandBoundaryDefinition.description: Designation of criterion for defining maximum and minimum wavelengths for a spectral band.

nominalSpatialResolution.description: The smallest distance between which separate points can be distinguished, as specified in instrument design.

transferFunctionType.description: Type of transfer function to be used when scaling a physical value for a given element.

imageDescription.json.description: Information about an image's suitability for use.

illuminationElevationAngle.description: Illumination elevation measured in degrees clockwise from the target plane at intersection of the optical line of sight with the Earth’s surface. For images from a scanning device, refer to the centre pixel of the image.

illuminationAzimuthAngle.description: Illumination azimuth measured in degrees clockwise from true north at the time the image is taken. For images from a scanning device, refer to the centre pixel of the image

imagingCondition.description: Code which indicates conditions which may affect the image.

cloudCoverPercent.description: Area of the dataset obscured by clouds, expressed as a percentage of the spatial extent.

compressionQuantity.description: Count of the number of lossy compression cycles performed on the image.

triangulationIndicator.description: Indication of whether or not triangulation has been performed upon the image.

radiometricCalibrationAvailable.description: Indication of whether or not the radiometric calibration information for generating the radiometrically calibrated standard data product is available.

cameraCalibrationAvailable.description: Indication of whether or not constants are available which allow for camera calibration corrections.

filmDistortionAvailable.description: Indication of whether or not Calibration Reseau information is available

lensDistortionAvailable.description: Indication of whether or not lens aberration correction information is available.

taxonomy.json.description: Information on the taxa (1 or more) included in the data set, including keywords, taxonomic system and coverage information, and taxonomic classification system.

taxonomicSystem.description: Information about the taxonomic classification system used.

generalScope.description: Description of the range of taxa addressed in the data set or collection. For example, "all vascular plants were identified to family or species, mosses and lichens were identified as moss or lichen".

identificationReference.description: Information on any non-authoritative materials (e.g. field guides) useful for reconstructing the actual process.

observer.description: Information about the individual(s) responsible for the identification(s) of the specimens or sightings. etc.

identificationProcedure.description: Description of the methods used for taxonomic identification. Could include specimen processing, comparison with museum materials, keys, and key characters, chemical or genetic analyses, etc.

identificationCompleteness.description: Information concerning the proportions and treatment of unidentified materials (i.e. materials sent to experts, and not yet determined); estimates of the importance, and identities of misidentifications, uncertain determinations, synonyms or other incorrect usages; taxa not well treated or requiring further work; and expertise of field workers.

voucher.description: Information on the types of specimen, the repository, and the individuals who identified the vouchers.

citation.description: Information about the classification system or authority used.

modifications.description: Description of any modifications or exceptions made to the classification system or authority used.

taxonomicClassification.title: taxonomicClassification
taxonomicClassification.description: Information about the range of taxa addressed in the data set or collection. NOTE It is recommended that one provide information starting from the taxonomic rank of kingdom, to a level which reflects the data set or collection being documented.

taxonomicSystemId.description: The ID assigned by the taxonomic system to the taxonomicRank.

taxonomicLevel.description: Name of the taxonomic rank for which the taxonValue is provided. Example: "Kingdom", "Division", "Phylum", "Subphylum", "SuperClass", "Class", "SubClass", "InfraClass", "Superorder", "Order", "Suborder", "Infraorder", "Superfamily", "Family", "Subfamily", "Tribe", "Subtribe", "Genus", "Species".

taxonomicName.description: Taxonomic rank value of the taxon being described.

commonName.description: Specification of applicable common names. These common names may be general descriptions of a group of organisms if appropriate (e.g. insects, vertebrate, grasses, waterfowl, vascular plants, etc.).

voucher.description: Information on the types of specimen, the repository, and the individuals who identified the vouchers.

specimen.description: Word or phrase describing the type of specimen collected (e.g. 'herbarium specimens', 'blood samples', 'photographs', 'individuals', or 'batches').

repository.description: Information about the curator or contact person and/or agency responsible for the specimens.

citation.description: Information about the classification system or authority used.

modifications.description: Description of any modifications or exceptions made to the classification system or authority used.

taxonomy.json_definitions_voucher.description: Information on the types of specimen, the repository, and the individuals who identified the vouchers.

specimen.description: Word or phrase describing the type of specimen collected (e.g. 'herbarium specimens', 'blood samples', 'photographs', 'individuals', or 'batches').

repository.description: Information about the curator or contact person and/or agency responsible for the specimens.

taxonomy.json_definitions_taxonomicClass.title: taxonomicClassification
taxonomy.json_definitions_taxonomicClass.description: Information about the range of taxa addressed in the data set or collection. NOTE It is recommended that one provide information starting from the taxonomic rank of kingdom, to a level which reflects the data set or collection being documented.

taxonomicSystemId.description: The ID assigned by the taxonomic system to the taxonomicRank.

taxonomicLevel.description: Name of the taxonomic rank for which the taxonValue is provided. Example: "Kingdom", "Division", "Phylum", "Subphylum", "SuperClass", "Class", "SubClass", "InfraClass", "Superorder", "Order", "Suborder", "Infraorder", "Superfamily", "Family", "Subfamily", "Tribe", "Subtribe", "Genus", "Species".

taxonomicName.description: Taxonomic rank value of the taxon being described.

commonName.description: Specification of applicable common names. These common names may be general descriptions of a group of organisms if appropriate (e.g. insects, vertebrate, grasses, waterfowl, vascular plants, etc.).

format.json.title: format
format.json.description: Provides information about the format used.

formatSpecification.description: Citation of the specification for the format.

amendmentNumber.description: Amendment number of the format version.

compressionMethod.description: Recommendations of algorithms or processes that can be applied to read or expand resources to which compression techniques have been applied.

technicalPrerequisite.description: Description of any technical capabilities that the consumer must have to use the data set in the form(s) provided by the distributor.

keyword.description: Commonly used word(s) or formalized word(s) or phrase(s) used to describe the subject.

keywordType.description: A code, or concept, that defines the subject matter used to group similar keywords.

thesaurus.description: Name of the formally registered thesaurus or a similar authoritative source of keywords.

keyword.description: Commonly used word(s) or formalized word(s) or phrase(s) used to describe the subject.

keywordType.description: ISO Topic Category keywords. Keywords must match list defined by ISO 19115.

keyword.description: Array of ISO Topic Category keywords.
Commonly used word(s) or formalized word(s) or phrase(s) used to describe the subject.

keywordType.description: ISO Topic Category keywords. Keywords must match list defined by ISO 19115.

keyword.description: Array of ISO Topic Category keywords.

usage.json.description: Description of ways in which the resource is currently or has been used.

specificUsage.description: A brief description about how the resource is being used.

temporalExtent.description: Date and time of the first use or range of uses of the resource and/or resource series.

userDeterminedLimitation.description: A brief description of applications, determined by the user, for which the resource is not suitable.

documentedIssue.description: Citation of a description of known issues associated with the resource along with proposed solutions if available.

additionalDocumentation.description: Publications that describe usage of data.

userContactInfo.description: Identification of the persons and/or organizations that are using the resource.

locale.json.description: Localised language(s) and characterset(s) used within the resource being described.

language.description: Language(s) used within the resource. Should be a valid ISO 639-3 code.

characterSet.description: Full name of the character encoding standard used by the resource(see http://www.iana.org/assignments/character-sets/character-sets.xhtml).

country.description: Designation of the specific country of the locale language(ISO 3166-1).

maintInfo.json.description: Information about the maintenance of a resource.

frequency.description: Describes the frequency of additions and updates made to a resource.

scope.description: Type of resource to which the maintenance information applies.

note.description: Notes regarding the maintenance of the resource.

contact.description: Contact information for the maintainer of the resource.
